review_content: Bottle@ Sushi w friends/Boilermaker. Appearance: pours clear yellow with ok soapy off-white head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, bread, light grass and light floral notes. palette: medium malty aroma, average carbonation, light to medium body, light to medium sweetness, balanced by a light to medium bitterness, short duration, light dry finish and a watery texture. Overall: pretty standard

Pours clear golden with a smallish but stable head. Sweetish and malty aroma with notes of corn, cereal, a bit of butterscotch and a hint of vegetables. Taste follows the aroma with smooth and sweetish malty flavors. Finishes with a faint touch of metallic bitterness. Soft to average carbonation. On the sweeter side of the lagers.( poured from a 330 ml bottle, bb 24.11.21, brewed by an European license holder)

Colore giallo dorato, quasi ambrato e la schiuma è abbondante e persistente. Il profumo è caratterizzato dai cereali, molto maltato. Il busto è bilanciato tra malti e luppoli, con un finale leggermente amaro e il risultato è una birra leggera e rinfrescante. Una normale lager industriale.
Barwa jasnobursztynowa, piana szybko opada. Piwo bardzo wodniste. Jakieś tam słody czuć, ale niewiele. Nieszczególny aromat i smak. Niezłe jak na lager, ale też bez rewelacji.

330ml bottle. Crystal clear, dark yellow-ish to orangey, golden colour with average, thick, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, snow-white head. Grainy and strawy, pale malty aroma, soapy overtones. Taste is slightly dry, soapy hoppy, grainy and strawy malty, very subtle sweetness. 
Watery texture, smooth and soft palate, very fine, slightly prickly carbonation.
Very clean, monotonous, but balanced and quite drinkable - not a black-out.
Jasnozłote, klarowne piwo o średniej pianie, która dość szybko redukuje się do zera. Aromat i smak nikły słodowy. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie typowy jasny lager z koncernu.
The aroma of malt. Golden color, clear with small head. The taste of malt without hops. Light body, carbonation is medium.

Light but has flavour.
Little dry, little sweet, balanced.
Very easy to drink a lot of.
Refreshing.
Fles 33cl bij Kota Radja in Zwolle. Malttonen, bittertje, redelijk zacht. (9-7-2020).

Unclarity about the name: drinking a "premium beer" of 4.7%... Anyway; crystal clear golden pour with white head, that melts down quickly. Aroma is malty. Taste is bitter-sweet but on the sweet side for a pilsener. Bit watery feel. Middle of the road factory beer, nothing special, even bit disappointing.

Bottled. Clear pale yellow colour, small and fast melting white head. Corny and papery aromas. Sweet tast with dusty grains and metallic finish. Thin body, average carbonation, watery mouthfeel, blank finish. Awful.

Enjoyed: Poured from bottle into lager glass. 
Appearance: Golden colour, small head with small lacing.
Aroma: Malt, grains.
Palate: Medium body, gentle carbonation.
Taste: Malt, corn, grains, hops, gently bitter aftertaste. 
Overall impression: Usual industrial beer but still good and tasty enough.
Note: My bottle is not brewed in Japan but in Ireland (Diageo)?
# 1814; 2/2020. Rice and grains in aroma. Gold, clear body. Light body, worty, grainy, herbal, very sweet. Bad lager. 0,3 l bottle from asian food shop, Prague. Somewhere in EU produced beer.

Classic lager, nothing special.
Watery taste with little bitterness.
Drinkable.
Weak foam

Butelka 330 ml; wersja europejska. Pierwszy buch aromatu zaskakująco dobry, pilsnerowy. Ale z czasem został w smaku głównie słód i szczyptka chmieliku. Czy dobrze zbalansowany? Nie rzekłbym. Ładne, złociste, klarowne, z ładną białą nawet trwałą pianką i lejsingiem. Oprócz wyglądu - pozytywnych wyróżników brak. Zaliczono, wielkiego dramatu i wad nie było.

Bottle@ Sushi w friends/Boilermaker. Appearance: pours clear yellow with ok soapy off-white head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, bread, light grass and light floral notes. palette: medium malty aroma, average carbonation, light to medium body, light to…

Pours clear golden with a smallish but stable head. Sweetish and malty aroma with notes of corn, cereal, a bit of butterscotch and a hint of vegetables. Taste follows the aroma with smooth and sweetish malty flavors. Finishes with a faint touch of metallic…

330ml bottle. Crystal clear, dark yellow-ish to orangey, golden colour with average, thick, frothy to creamy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, snow-white head. Grainy and strawy, pale malty aroma, soapy overtones. Taste is slightly dry, soapy hoppy, grainy and…

The aroma of malt. Golden color, clear with small head. The taste of malt without hops. Light body, carbonation is medium.
Light but has flavour. Little dry, little sweet, balanced.…
Fles 33cl bij Kota Radja in Zwolle. Malttonen, bittertje, redelijk zacht. (9-7-2020).

Unclarity about the name: drinking a "premium beer" of 4.7%... Anyway; crystal clear golden pour with white head, that melts down quickly. Aroma is malty. Taste is bitter-sweet but on the sweet side for a pilsener. Bit watery feel. Middle of the road factory…

Bottled. Clear pale yellow colour, small and fast melting white head. Corny and papery aromas. Sweet tast with dusty grains and metallic finish. Thin body, average carbonation, watery mouthfeel, blank finish. Awful.
Enjoyed: Poured from bottle into lager glass. Appearance: Golden colour, small head with small lacing. Aroma: Malt, grains.…
# 1814; 2/2020. Rice and grains in aroma. Gold, clear body. Light body, worty, grainy, herbal, very sweet. Bad lager. 0,3 l bottle from asian food shop, Prague. Somewhere in EU produced beer.
Classic lager, nothing special. Watery taste with little bitterness.…

Butelka 330 ml; wersja europejska. Pierwszy buch aromatu zaskakująco dobry, pilsnerowy. Ale z czasem został w smaku głównie słód i szczyptka chmieliku. Czy dobrze zbalansowany? Nie rzekłbym. Ładne, złociste, klarowne, z ładną białą nawet…

To be honest i don't know the difference between all "Sapporo" premium beers out there. It seems many people said that the draft is different beer and also the "U.S" and "E.U." Personal i taste the "E.U" and it is very refreshing and pleasand lager beer to drink.. It is very crisp indeed and you can taste some rice notes here but at 80% its like one casual and ordinary good "Lager" beer. Is much more better beer than ugly "Heineken" or some other "famous Lager" beers in the west civilization.
Overall i was very curious to taste this beer because i love almost everything about japan and because i already taste the "Asahi super dry" beer and i like it very much.. This beer for the style is great. Refreshing dangerous drinkable, pleasand but still i prefer to drink "Asahi super dry" over this.. "Asahi" is a very different and unique beer out there and make the difference between all these common "Lagers"..
It reminds me of the old time when I drunk local beer in China. Taser similar. This time I got it in Sushi Zushi in downtown SA.
33 cl bottle at home on August 3rd as Sapporo Premium Lager (4,7%). Not bad, but a bit watery.
Typowy lager zupełnie niczym nie różni się od polskich koncerniaków. Nic ciekawego.
330 ml bottle. Poured golden with white head. Low aroma of corn, grain and yeast. The taste is medium grain, slightly bitter and sweetish corn. Light body, watery texture, effervescent carbonation.

Bottle from Kaufland 2019-06-10 Göteborg 
AR: rustic bready, syrup, corn
AP: clear coppery, wee head
F: syrup, evident alcohol, corn juice
Orange color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.
Blond bier met snel verdwijnende schuimkraag. Vrij vlak weinig onderscheidend bier. Smaak moutig en iets bitter, smaak blijft niet lang hangen.

08/04/2019 - 33cl bottle @Lily's Noodle House Kortrijk.
Clear golden, big white head; Nose is thin malts, bit yeast. Taste is malts, sweetish corn, yeast, wattery

Köpt på Östermalm. Smakar inte så mycket. Sämre än Annan japansk öl som t.ex. asahi. Oklart användningsområde 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Zeer vlakke smaak, schuim verdwijnt onmiddellijk. Drinkt wel vlot door, maar geen smaak

Bottle from Lidl in Ghent. Pours clear golden with a quickly thinning, off-white head. Faint aroma of corn, grain, white bread, yeast, citrus. Taste is medium grainy bitter, faintly sourish & wheaty, some sweetish corn. Dryish, grainy finish, corn, some iron. Light body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. Okay, just quenching with some takeaway Asian food.

330ml bottle with ABV at 4.7% from Edea, drunk at home on a foggy January evening. Pours crystal clear with a coarsely fluffy head, some lacing for a minute or so and rising carbonation that persisted well. Pale gold in colour. On the nose, malts dominate with buttered corn, bread, biscuit and hints of metallic honey. In the mouth, flavours pretty consistent with the aromas, some sweetness at first, a smooth - mellow - Hell-like texture giving way to harsh unbalanced bitterness through the finish. Overall, soft and gentle at first, but tough at the end. Not terrible, but doesn't deserve to be exported.

Tap @ MOJO, Amsterdam X 2019. Redelijk volle moutige smaak voor een lager waardoor het toch meer body krijgt. Lekker doordrinkbaar mooi zoetje en niet te waterig met een gemiddeld bittertje wat iets sterker had mogen zijn. Helder geel bier maar iets te weinig koolzuur waarbij de schuimkraag vrij snel verdwenen is. Hierdoor krijgt het biertje te snel een doods uiterlijk wat jammer is. Want deze lager drinkt gewoon lekker weg. :-) Origineel glas
Da probamo i Japansko pivo... čudno je, kao i sve ostalo japansko, ali jako pitko i ugodno! Rekao bih izgleda kao tipičan lager, okus ne mogu odrediti
Poměrně chutný Pale lager. Vyšší nasycení, chuť sladová, klasické "asijské rýžové" tóny.
330ml bottle from Bliznetsy in Moscow (also tried in Japan). Pours clear gold with a tall white head. Aroma is floral and a bit skunky, grain, malt. Taste is light sweet, pale malt, grainy.
En standard humle lager. Ganska smaklös. Perfekt för de som inte gillar för mastig öl.
Geen tot smaak van hop en voornamelijk zoetig van smaak door de gebruikte mouten. voor een lager iets licht van kleur. -backlog de BierApp-

Uma cerveja leve que na temperatura ideal mostra se ideal para uma tarde de verão ! 
Equilibrada e neutra em sabor

Large bottle served in Tonki, Meguro. Clear pale golden beer, with a large white foam head. Nose is light pale cereal malts, barley, straw, light grass, biscuit malt, dry lager yeast. Taste as above. Bottled Sapporo seems to have a bit more flavour than the draft label.
Can. Golden color, with a small white head. Aroma is malty, taste too, with some herbal hops. Ok lager, probably the better one between the usual 3-4 beers you can find in japanese restaurants.
Thuis in de tuin, met Laura en Howard. Dorstlessertje, simpel pilsje, weinig onderscheidend. Mis een bittertje, erg vlak.

Flasche 33cl. Laut Etikett mit Gerstenrohfrucht gebraut. Recht trockenes Lager mit getreidigem Abgang, nicht sehr viel Hopfen. Insgesamt harmonischer Eindruck ohne Highlights, guter Begleiter zu asiatischem Essen. Positiv zu werten, dass keine Chemie verwendet wurde.

Aromat lagerowy, nieco stechly, troche estrowy, malo przyjemny i intensywny. Barwa zlota, idealnie klarowne, piana drobna, poczatkowo obfita ale szybko opadajaca. W smaku lekkie, polslodkie, slodowe, owocowe. Goryczka niska ale jest, wysycenie wysokie. Słaby lager.

Can: 500 ml, Price: 0,90 eur,ABV: 4,7% 

Sapporo Premium Beer.
Zakupene v podniku peach. Vona na svetle pivo nezvycajna. Ja tam citim cokoladu. Farba zlatista. Chut sklamala. Taka vodova nicim zvlastna.

Konečně mé první japonské pivo. Hodně se podobá těm českým, jelikož v Japonsku pracuje hodně českých sládků. Nebyl to žádný zázrak, ale také to nebylo nějak špatné pivo, náhodou jsem byl překvapen. Jemný říz i aroma, nízká perlivost a řídká pěna.
Yellow coloured beer with an small white head. Aroma is grainy and light malty. Flavor is thin, malty and cardboard. Short finish and thin palate.
Gemiddeld moutig.. weinig tot geen hop.. crisp wat zoetig... zeeer saai maar drinkbaar
Bottle from asia shop in Frankfurt. Transfer of an earlier rating without text recorded, rating only.

Have had this several times in Japanese restaurants from a bottle. Good quaffing beer and seems to go well with sushi too. 

F Avey---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flesje gedeeld met Bart. Goudgeel helder bier met weinig schuim. Weinig aroma. Smaak is fruitig en hoppig. Nasmaak is iets hoppig.

Bottle from Thai supermarket in Prenton. 
Appearance - golden with a decent head. 
Nose - light grassiness and citrus. Possibly some Saaz spice. 
Taste - more citrus and spice. Biscuit. 
Palate - light bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - decent.
Pours clear yellow with small white head. Sweetish malty lager with barley aroma. Pleasant and drinkable

Pours pale golden. 

Aroma is malty, grainy and light. 


Taste is thin, cardboard, malt. 

Watery texture. Medium carbonation.
Bottle at masashi. Straw gold colour. Straw, bread, dough nose. Flavour is a metallic bread.
Bottle. Pours clear golden with small white head. Aroma and taste have some sweet malts. Actually even tasty lager.

Dans un restau japonais...couleur dorée claire, très légère mousse. Nez légèrement malté typique lager industrielle. Gout leger malté avec notes un peu céréales. Corps aqueux. Fin sur note très légèrement amere...
0.33l bottle. Clear golden color with high decent white head. Aroma: caramel, rye bread, grain. Taste: almost no aroma and no bitterness, slight malty aroma and sweetness. Light body.
Crisp and refreshing light corn an a metallic hint decent for a macro lager.
Bottle@home; appearance: clear golden with thin white head; aroma: malty; taste: malty; palate: dry, medium body, low carbonation; overall: ok
Backlog. Przenoszenie ocen z innego serwisu, z czasów przed założeniem konta na ratebeer

F: thin, white, quick gone.
C: gold, totally clear.
A: malty, grainy, grassy, floral, caramel, bread.
T: malt, grassy, bread, grainy, caramel, corn, macro pale lager as well, medium body, good carbonation, 33cl bottle (EU Brew), from Kam Yuen Supermarket in Brussels.
[backlog] 17-04-16 // bottle at Sushileecious, Wiesbaden. Pours a clear golden colour. Solid white head. Grainy, rice. Water. Light.
Grains, golden with a good white head, light body, medium carbonation, malty...a lager like many other in a splendid can.

Aroma: Appel
Appearance: Licht, geen schuim, bruizend
Taste: Licht,appel
Palate: Licht prikkelend
Overall: Licht en appeloverheersing

Au nez tout de suite on est sur les céréales(riz)
En bouche on va la trouver sucré et malté on dirait une bière qui n’ai pas terminé d’être fermentée
Overly sweet and kind of gross really. Thin and where is the malt again? Not feeling this one. Meh meh.

A japanese, golden lager with white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, light fresh fruit, light raisins. Taste is light bitter sweet. A bit watery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Una lager más sin aspiraciones que refresca como cualquier otra y que sabe rica en una terraza de verano bebida directamente en la botella helada.

ラガー   
日本のよりは甘いか？

Bottiglia. L’intensità olfattiva è normale e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Appena aperta la bottiglia arrivano sentori di orzo e luppolo. Il cappello di schiuma a bollicine medie ha scarsa tenuta. Il perlage ha bollicine fini. L’aspetto del liquido è limpido. Il colore è giallo ambrato. Il corpo è rotondo. L’amaro è moderato. L’intensità olfattiva è normale e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva.
Flaske. farven er gylden med kun lidt hvidt skum. Aromaen er korn og malt og smagen er ligeså. En almindelig lager.
Clear golden with thin white head. Light malty with some cardboard and nuts. Backlog from 2014/05/03.
33cl Flasche. Goldgelbe Farbe wenig Schaum. Getreide und etwas Frucht in der Nase. Geschmack für ein Lager ganz ok.
33cc bottle. Pours clear light blond color with almost no head. Low carbonation, Fruit aroma, sweet taste and finish.
Clara,creme e carbonatação médios,sabor suave e refrescante,por se uma premium esperava algo mais,cerveja mediana.

It has a fresh and welcoming scent of hops, newly harvested grains and a touch of lime / lemon. The flavor has a slight citrus flavor and good full body with a pleasant hop bitterness terminating in a dry aftertaste. In Japan apparently liked the somewhat dry lager types for just the dryness is common in the Japanese lagers I’ve tasted. My overall rating is a good thirst quencher with medium flavor and richness.

Can. Pours gold with a thick white head and lots of carbonation. Slight floral and skunk aroma. Very thin beginning, very little flavor. Some sourness followed by just a touch of hop bitterness. Not that good but drinkable. Unique packaging.

I like Japanese beers a lot, I don’t know why. This one is pretty common, I bought the steel 22 ounce can and downed it yesterday. Very calmer than most pale lagers, it kinda tastes a little watery, not as in your face with sweetness. Slightly drying, slightly more citrus and floral in the nose and taste. Appearance is nice, a blond with hints of darker orange, very nice bubbles and foam.

Bottled. Not bad. But sweet at the end. Passable and better than Miller. Decent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
has bitter taste with nice aroma. Palate is as same as beer itself not so much fruity btw

Bottle on sale from Bert’s Bierhuis. The beer is yellow to light golden colored and pours a small and stable white head. The aroma is grainy, with also tones of malts, a hint of citrus and some grass. Taste is very light and malty and further very watery, with some light bitterness. The finish is watery and light bitter and is noticable for a while. Not good, but drinkable.

Golden color with an ok white head. Grainy and malty aroma. Medium body with an ok carbonation. Tad sweet and a moderate bitterness. Grainy, mild fruity and malty flavor. Nothing to recommend.
[Bottle at a restaurant in Copenhagen, Denmark]

Dorada pálida de espuma blanca. Dulce en el aroma con algo de cereal y mínimo lúpulo aromático. Sabor neutro, manteniendo los tonos del aroma, con un suave amargor algo metálico. Ligera de cuerpo. Otra lager industrial del montón

Pours greenish golden. White head.
Aroma is low: bread, iron, a hint of honey.
Aggressive carbonation. Watery, lightest body, flat. Forgettable.
Pale color, lively beer, served locally from tap, a nice beer that started to be found more and more often outside Japan.

Pretty aweful a small step up from bud light. Tiny bit of flavor but classic gross beer flavor. Light aroma. I couldn't finish the bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Enjoyed at BTBF 2015. Light golden appearance. Rice logger aroma, grains. Sweet flavor of rice and grains.
I’ll take this any day of the week over a Budweiser. And that says something. Definitely malt heavy, and the rice is slightly perceptible.
Clear yellow body with white head. Grainy malt aroma, lingering wet wash cloth smell. Light hop taste. Thin body mediocre at best.
12.6.2014. Light aroma with a bit more malts than bulks usually. Taste is similar, pale malts, slight hay, ok basic lager.

clear golden colour, minimal white head, which completely disappears within some minutes; aroma of grains, some cardboard and hints of raspberry (???); taste is the same with some sourness; not really good lager but drinkable

33cl bottle bb03/15, local Asia markt. Pours a very dull grainy beige. Nose of stale almond malts, dish rag. Some almond malt quality again in taste before it falls flat on its dry grainy ass. OK hop bitterness and husks in the finish - not half bad, I’ve had many worse Belgian macro lagers.

Bottle from Seoul Plaza. Aroma overpasteurized, dull washing cloth, raw grainy. Clear golden colour, moderately sized head, quickly disappearing. Taste could be worst, honestly. It is dull, empty, neutral, which is probably a good thing. Some washing cloth, some grainy notes, almost malty. Very lightly astringent finish. If forced to go for a Japanese macro, I would rather reach for Asahi Black.

Copenhagen 28/9 2014. 50 cl can from Irma. Pours clear and light yellow with big white head which settles as 0,5 centimetres lacing. Aroma is a bit sour but rather unremarkable. Medium carbonation. Taste is very watery - a bit grainy and very little bitterness. Does not get in the way if you drink it with your sushi - but does not do anything for you either. Except quench your thirst.
Pours golden with a small/medium white head. Thin with not a tonne of flavour, but still nice and refreshing (and great with a big bowl of ramen!).
Pale gold. Taste of corn, grains, just a little bit of bitterness to it. Kind of fizzy. Easy enough to drink as a regular beer, but nothing too speci
Thin body, light blond color, grainy aromas. Taste of corn and grains with a yeasty aftertaste. A bit bitter at the end. Nothing special at all.

Bottle@De Tolly Joogipood. Pours golden with white frothy head.Aroma of typical macro lager.Taste is a bit better then aroma, some sweetness, malty, some sourness, slight hops. Light body. Medium carbonation. Nothing special.
330ml bottle. Clear and golden. Medium sized white head. Watery, not much flavor. Average carbonation. Lightly bitter.

Perhaps this is not a special, micro-brewed, fancy so-and-so drink. I get that. But for what it is, which is an affordable lager (commonly found at sushi joints) that comes in a snazzy can, it’s pretty good! Definitely a very carbonated, light drink with a wheat-ish kind of taste. It’s a cheap, easy beer that I’d recommend to anybody who isn’t overtly snobby. A definite win!
Pale gold. Taste of corn, grains, just a little bit of bitterness to it. Kind of fizzy. Easy enough to drink as a regular beer, but nothing too special.

- Alcoholpercentage van 4,7%
- Biertje gedronken destijds dat me niet kon bekoren
- Kan me veel lekkerder biertjes voorstellen, maar kan met mijn smaakvoorstelling te maken hebben
- Vandaar mijn lage beoordeling

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap with commonmac at zen box. Clear gold with little head. Smells grainy and sweet. Very easy to drink. Has the watery old grain taste reminiscent of cheap American beer. Not much flavor at all. Again, easy to drink.
Can. Color clear gold with medium white head. Aroma corn, grass. Taste corn, grass, malt.
330ml bottle from Lidl (brewed in Ireland). Good, decent drinkable beer. Bitterness above average.
standard lager for better and worse...much better than some of the swill out there, but still nothing I’d get again given decent choices. crisp and dry. good with sushi.

500ml can served in a chalice.
A: Pours a pale yellow clear color forming a medium bubbled white head. Retention is low and some few lacings are left
S: Smells like white bread. Very grainy with some grassy hops
T: Very grainy too. Sweet grains upfront. Bitter hops aftertaste. Lager yeasts can be noticed too. A bit metallic. In overall, a dry bitter taste
M: Very light body. Strong carbonation. Reasonable hoppy bitter aftertaste
O: Average Lager. Easy drinking beer
[ BA Review @ 6/27/2012 ]

I really like the smooth taste of this beer very easy to drink for this beer novice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle. Clear golden color. Medium size, white head, stays. Malty, bit sour, minerals in aroma. Minerals, bit salty, malty taste. Very watery. Soft carbonation. Neutrally tasteless.
33 cl East West Sushi Örebro. Smaklös lager som jag inte önskar ge min värsta fiende.

330ml bottle - brewed in the EU

Stinky off aroma. Pale, fizzy. Watery. Corny taste. Hint of extracty hops. Weak watery nonsense. Papery as the hop extracts build up.

Aroma: light grain malts. Appearance: clear, pale gold, medium, frothy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: remains bitter throughout, boring grain malts. Overall: boring Pale Lager. Can from Lidl, Port de Alcudia.
Bottle. Thin grainy broth on chlorine infused pool water, with a suggestion of apples and a dry, astringent bitterness. Very unpleasant experience.

Sapporo Premium Lager, 4.7%, 10.8°. Brewed by Diageo in Dundalk. Rated this under that other entry... moving the rating. :)
 Poured a golden colour with a small white head that went away fast. Malty nose, a bit flowery. Ok actually. Empty, watery taste, Some spicy hops, a bit lemoney, dusty, some alcohol (wtf) and some maltiness that keeps itself way back in the background. Very faint lemon seed aftertaste. Drinkable but unimpressive and at the price (10.90kn) not something I’ll drink again soon.
Of all of the things you order with sushi, Sapporo is probably one of the better Japanese options. Same-old ricey watery lager.
Bottle. Typical light tasting international lager. Fell clearly into the ’murky damp’- category of those, even if it had quite a bit of neutral rice/maize tastelessness.
Weisser Schaum auf klaren goldgelben Bier. Der Duft ist Hopfenhaltig. Der erste Schluck ist leicht bitter, aber dennoch mild im Abgang. Bier ist OK.
Clear yellow golden appearance, medium head. Malty and light, typical and not outstanding Pale Lager.
0,3l Flasche. Gelbes Lagerbier mit relativ kleiner Schaumkrone. Riecht leicht malzig, wird im Geschmack bestätigt, zum Abschluß etwas bitter.

Popular Japanese standard ’pils’ with pale golden colour and loose, snow white head; malt sweetness in the nose as well as corn and a vague sourish touch, finished with faint aromatic hops. Neutral taste, vague sweetishness, grainy and some corn with mild hop bitterishness in the finish, bit metallic too. Just another boring mass-marketed pale lager.

Clear golden with small white head. Light malty with some cardboard and nuts. Light fruit and herbal bitterness. I actually quite like the nutty malts, if this would have more hops it would be good, now it’s just a above average macro lager. I drank half and then used the other half to catch snails there were eating my pepper plants. I actually cough a 250ml cup full of snails with only 100ml beer, so even if you don’t like to drink this it’s recommended to get rid of snail problems.

Sapporo has made its reputation as the leading beer in the Japanese Sushi Bars. Sapporo is technically a rice lager, as they use the rice to mass produce the beer in Japan. The rice lightens both the flavor and the color of the beer, but also reduce the alcohol content and the hop flavor. This beer is light and dry, and pairs perfect with sushi since it will not overpower the flavors of the sashimi or sushi rolls. Enough said, that's why it's the perfect beer for the sushi lovers!!

500 ml can from LCBO.  This stuff is brewed in Guelph I’m pretty sure, so maybe in Japan it tastes better, but I doubt it.  Clear golden pour, spongy white head disappears quickly.  Aroma of straw, grass, corn and a little copper.  Watery mouthfeel.  Low hay malt.  Finishes with a little grassy hop.  Pretty inoffensive and bland.
Poured from a bottle. Aroma is grass, corn. Flavor is typical lager. Bleh. Not my style, but would make a OK summer beer.
Drank out of the famous indestructable can.  golden, fizzy, not bitter, no body.

Bottle: Pale yellow beer a white head. Sweet grainy aroma with weak notes of straw, grass and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Quite crisp, slightly watery and averagely carbonated. Dry, light bitter finish. OK as a companion to sushi, but streamlined. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear yellow looks. Grainy, light, accessible and sweet. Tastes see too, with light carbonation. It?s another mass produced lager.
Bottle: pours a clear yellow with a small white head... Smells like grains and corn.  It tastes like malt, and corn.  Not good.
Pours clear yellow with a fluffty white head and a light floral aroma. There is a standard pale malt flavor with slight hop bitterness and a dry finish.
33cl Can, courtesy of Joes. Clear yellow / golden color, small white head. Smell and taste malts, grains and rice. Low carbonation, low body.

Clear pale yellow, thin white head. Corny grainy lager aroma and taste. Thin, fizzy and refreshing. Japanese industrial swill, brewed in Canada.
LF (Lagerboy Friendly)

330 ml Bottle picked up in the Japan resturant in the Frankfurt Airport, Germany. My bottle says it was brewed in London. Pours a pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt and some hops. The taste is plain, some hops and some metal. Palate is ok somewhat smooth. Nothing special.

650ml can

Pretty simple lager. I got loads of Pilsener malt in both the aroma and taste, slight hop aroma. Clean and brilliantly clear.

(blind-sampled at Election Day Pale Lager Challenge) Pours a clear, pale golden with medium, white head. Aroma is faint, cardboard and slightly starchy, malty. Watery on the palate, weak-bodied, medium carbonation and no finish. Not much taste - a little, vegetal bitterness. Girlfriend says: "Really common."
33cl fles. Helder goudgeel kleur, fijne romige witte schuimkraag. De geur is mout en gras. Smaak is zoet, mout, maïs en gras. Licht body en veel koolzuur.
Your typical japanese lager, although it at least has a faint taste of grain.  I hesitate to say grain?  Drank in a can.
(Can 06/08-2011) Large white head, clear yellow color, medium CO2, mild malty taste.
Bottled. Yellowish golden colour, small white head. Aroma is rice, malts, some slight grassy and floral notes. Flavour is the same along with some mild grains. Quite thin bodied and watery palate.

On a whim that big silver can beckoned.
Pours a pale straw yellow with a big fluffy head that falls quickly, but sticks a fair amount of sticky lace on the sides. Smells lightly of grainy malts, maybe some earthy floral hops. Uninspiring nose puts it mildly. Taste is grainy and slightly sweet, hints of tartness in there somehow with an astringent finish. Crisp carbonation, thin body and a watery mouthfeel. Well that’s not all that tasty. Its a thin bodied macro lager with almost no redeeming qualities, one and done for this one.
Can. Pours clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma is light hops, light fruit and light malt. The flavour is sweet malt, light hops and light fruit.
Can 500 ml, pours goulden with Nice White head, aroma is corn, bit hops.. The flavor is very pilsner, corn, hops... Thin ...

A pretty sorry excuse for a beer & not one that I’ll buy again. It wasn’t that it tasted bad, it’s just that it fell short in so many areas & really didn’t impress me. Drinkable but not really worth your while, I’d put this on a par with most of the mass-market pale lagers you can buy for a lot cheaper. * * * * * 1001 Beers: How many have your tried? -

A: The pour is a pale yellow/straw color with a short lived white head.

S: Fairly minimal aroma here.  Mild straw and malt/grain to it with a little bit of sweetness to it.  Definitely a rice character to it, which is probably part of the reason it is so light.

T: Light hop bitterness is surprisingly noticeable.  Mild straw flavors as well as some hints of sweet malt and grain.  The rice presence is noticeable here as well.

M: Light in body with a moderate level of carbonation.

O: Not an amazing beer, but it’s easy to drink, especially with a typical Japanese meals.

33cl bottle at Sumo’s, Scheveningen.
Decent white head.  Normal pils colour.  Ok.

[330ml bottle, Peckham’s Stockbridge, Edinburgh] Clear golden yellow pour, decent white head with rising carbonation. Sweet malt and corn on the aroma. Similar tastes, with a ‘clean’ aftertaste being the case, except replace the word ‘clean’ with the word ‘no’. Far from disgraceful, it’s just decidedly average [15072008]

Can on Delta 278. Canadian brewed. Fruity, sweet, grainy aroma. Fake. Flavor of Sprite, sweet and fruity, and not very beer like at all. Not vile, but really like a shandy. Much worse than the Nama Kuro label in Japan.

Bottle: Clear, golden, stable creamy medium-sized white head; delicate honeyish-malty nose with a bitter-tart touch; mild bitter-sweet flavour, soft, not too light bodied; short tart-bitter finish. Unspectacular, reminds me somehow of japanese cars......
Can @ Papsø. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity grainy aroma. Sweetish malty grainy malty flavor. Has a sweetish fruity malty finish.

Common macro lager from, but it just so happens to be from Japan.  If you’re in a watering hole while visiting I guess I’d grab one in a bar.  Bottom line is that there is nothing special about this beer that you should seek it out.
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is light malty and straw. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. a bit light bodied and watery. Average pale lager. 050211

A clear golden colored beer with a white head. The aroma of fruits with nettle bitter. The taste has some hop bitter with fruits. But it is flat. The aftertaste hs some bitter, dry and hints of sweet.
bottle, donated by pivnizub. Clear golden colour, large white head. Malty base, shy hop flavours with a dusty touch.
Almost no head. Really light colour. Rice or corn smell. I don’t liek this. Very tasteless watery beer, quite miserably drink with or without hot side dish.

330 ml bottle, label reads that is made under license in the EU.  Pours a a clean bright yellow colour and a creamy head that does not hold for much long. Smell of hops and grains, nothing special here. But the surprise comes in the mouth, medium body, hops, some citrus and a very bitter dry finish that makes a difference compared with the usual macro lagers. Very drinkable and you can even enjoy it more than those brands that you all know and I’m not going to say.
golden beer with a white head. smells like straw and malts. taste is similar to the smell. Touch of citrus in the taste.
Golden beer.Collapsing head.Bitter,malts,light sweet,watery,dry,straw,dust.Ok with food.Nth special but drinkable.
Me la portano in un ristorante giapponese, quando chiedo una birra. Sinceramente è una birra che sa di poco, sia all’aroma e al gusto...

Bottle, 341 ml, license brewed in Canada.
Very pale, clear, quite a nice white head. No off flavors, actually does not taste like much at all. OK as a thirst quencher on a really hot summer day.

It’s totally average in every way, except I find the the finish is a little tastier than your average macro lager, and for that it’s a 2.7 instead of a 2.5. 
An ok, drink your face off, sorta beer.

From a 355ml bottle on 30/12/2010. Note that, despite being marketed as ’Japan’s Oldest Brand’, my bottle was brewed in Ontario, Canada (!) and was 5.0%, rather than 4.7%. Has a barely noticeable floral aroma and not much else. Taste wise, it’s not offensive but dull as dishwater. Poor.
Kan 50 cl. Klar bleg gylden med lille hvide hoved. Aroma og smag af malt. Lidt sur/bitter i afslutningen. Ikke nogen stor øl.

Reisille meni niinkuin suomalaisella mäkihyppääjällä Sapporossa. Tämä olut ei tee telemark-alastuloa, vaan suoriutuu vaimeasti. Valitettavasti samanlaisia oluita on maailma täynnä. Maltainen, maissinen ja viljainen tuoksu ja maku. Hieman hedelmäisyyttä maussa.
Bottle 33cl. A clear pale yellow beer with medium head. Smell is lager kind off. Aroma is mostly dry with a very low body, not very hoppy. Drinkable but no more.

Ok. It’s time for a rating, if this beer from Japan, from a real American!
Man! I swear that this beer tatsted better in High School, (30 years ago)!
Light pour with a thin head. Grassy, hay like, with a thick hoppy finish. 
It is a refreshing brew anytime. Where’s my Captians Reserve?
Can at Papsø’s - Thanks. Clear yellow - white head. Egg, plain malty, sour-bitterness, light hoppy, white bread, light hay, light artificial notes. Plain.
Golden colour and clear. Has a white head, mostly diminishing. Some odd malty sweetness in the aroma. Flavor is a bit astringent. But its easy to drink.
rotten eggs, golden, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, light body, thin feel,
Can from netto. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. short light bitter finish. Watery palate. Standard pale lager.
Can. Medium head with medium duration. Color is pale golden. Aroma and taste are sweet malt and hops.

Flaske 0,33l. Ekstremt lys gylden på farge. Hvitt skum som varer en stund. Aroma & smak er høy og søt malt. Tørr bitter ettersmak. 
(Restanseliste: Drukket 13 Jul 2006 i Kiruna).

Bottle:
White, quick disappearing, white foamy head on top of a clear and lighter yellow beer.
Smell malts, grains, some spices and hops.
Taste pretty typical, with some spices, malts and hops.

Pours dark golden with fluffy white head leaving lacing on the glass. Aroma of malts, hay, sweet alcohol. Tastes like a typical lager, malty and  hoppy slightly sweet. Acidy crisp and watery on palate. Finishes with a moderate hoppy aftertaste.

Can 500ml.

Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is light moderate malty, grain, toasted, cabbage water - vegetable, light hoppy. Flavor is light moderate sweet and light bitter with a average duration. Body is medium to light, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20101024]

Can at Papsø.
Clear yellow coloured with a small white head.
Malty aroma of hay and grain.
Malty flavour of grain with notes of hops.
Hoppy finish.
Bottled. A golden beer with a thin off.-whtii head. The aroma has notes of malt and straw.- Then flavor is sweet with notes of matl straw, and and citrus.

clear yellow small white head.
faint sweet malty aroma, faint bitternes.
flavor is malty, sligtllhly sourish or flowry hoppy, ends slightly bitter.
50 cL can. Pours clear and golden yellow with no head. Aroma is cornish and grassy. Cornish and slight sweet malty. Bitter and cornish. Dry finish.
Canned. Golden coloured. Clear. Dense off white head. Aroma of sweetness, grass and fruits. Flavour of grass and sweetness. thin bodied. Dry grassy bitterness.

Can 50 cl. Courtesy of Pinball. Pours a cleat golden with a dense white head. Malty nose with some brewing cereal. Medium body, brewing cereal, diacetyl and metal. Medium body, some brewing cereal, metal and chicory accents. A little late hops. 241010
50 cl can. Clear pale golden with small white head. Flavour is malt, sweet and watery.

500 ml can. Brewed under licence in the EU. From København, Denmark.

Clear pale golden colour with small white head.
Mild malty aroma with hints of grassy hops.
Flavour is quite weak with grainy malt and some grassy hoppy notes. 
Quite bland and boring Lager (or Pilsener).
Very similar to any commercial lager. Nothing special, tastes water. Weird aftertaste.
can at a japanese restaurant. average aroma, not a lot in the flavour but quite crisp and dry and refreshing.
This is one of the japanese beers that you can find in the japanese restaurants in Madrid. Everything about it has been said. Just a refreshing beer
Pours very pale yellow with virtually no head or lacing.  No aroma to speak of.  Very little taste to speak of, either.  It’s like drinking Coors Light.

Given to me at a party, pours a pale yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is of weak hops, very industrial lager like. Taste is fairly watered down. Light body, overall a poor beer, never again will I drink this.
Pours light gold out of the bottle. It has a sweet smell to It. Sweet lager taste.
0.33L bottle, small quickly dissapearing head, clear dark golden colour, malty aroma with some skunky hops, flavours of vanila and biscuit with some coarsly bitter hopsand sourness. Not really good.
Can. Weak malt aroma with a hint of citrus. Golden yellow colour with white head. Slighly bitter flavour. Quite ordinary pilsener.
Bottle and can. Pale yellow color with a white head. Taste, malt and hops. Watery taste with bitter finish. Nothing special.

MAR 27, 2009 (Relocated):
Yellow with nice white head, aroma of rice corn malt and some herbs, malty rice flat flavor, missing hops. OK

STANDARD MASS PRODUCED AROMA ON THIS CLEAR YELLOW WATERED DOWN BEER.IT DID START WITH A NICE THICK HEAD ON IT BUT IT WAS RUINED BY ITS SKUNKY CORN HAY LIKE FLAVOR AND METALIC AFTER TASTE WHICH AMAZINGLY STILL REMAINED SOMEWHAT  DRINKABLE . VERY SIMILAR YET SLIGHTLY BETTER THAN BUD.

Innocent. Like making love in a canoe ("fucking close to water"). But pleasent in the sun. Not bad.

 Purchased at Sachi Sushi at Vesterbrogade/Copenhagen.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Clear golden Japanese lager brewed and bottled in Britain, taste rather decently.

Re-rate 2/20/13: Bottle. Clear pale golden with a small white head. Vegetal and grainy aroma with creamed corn and faint grassy hints. Sweetish flavor with a bit of bready malt, grainy and vegetal notes and a finish with some mild bitterness. Light to medium-bodied. 3/3/4/3/7=2



Bottle. Brewed somewhere in the EU. Clear golden with a small white head. Grainy aroma with some corn and grassy notes. Weak sweetish flavor with a mildly bitter, somewhat grassy, finish. Light-bodied. Pretty bland but drinkable. 3/3/4/2/8

Sweet Jesus...anyone think this deserves any rating what-so-ever, must drink domestic corn piss every day. I made a mistake by drinking this at an International Brew Fest in Erie PA, and it was by far the worst beer I had all night, and I tried 36 beers ( 4 oz. at a time) I thought maybe my pallet was shot after an all nighter, so I rinsed with water and ate some crackers and cheese and tried again....blechh. Horrible. sorry I can’t really say much about taste and body and such. Cheers. :-(~
